CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper February 15, 1947, pg. 2, reads: "Lessons are Fun - Under the supervision of physical therapist Jacqueline Fike, the students at Pittsburgh's school for sufferers from cerebral palsy have fun while they practice muscular coordination. Peggy Blume watches her improvement in the huge mirror, as Betty Lou Claggett practices climbing steps. Joe McAllister is working on finger coordination at table... [illegible]. The classrooms are in the old Bedford School Building on the South Side... [ill.] Allegheny County Society for Crippled Children sponsors this work. E. H. Reis...[ill.] president of the organization. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Joe McAllister seated at table, Peggy Blume standing before mirror, Betty Lou Claggett or Clagget practicing stairs, and physical therapist Jacqueline Fike in school for cerebral palsy sufferers, Bedford School building, Southside
